title: Central Park: An Unmatched Urban Oasis (Deepak Nangla)
text: By Deepak Nangla Aug 26, 2015 The contemporary and magnificent city of New York is one of the most happening places of the planet. The breath-taking and much celebrated destination is home to many iconic landmarks which include Times Square, Empire State Building, Statute of Liberty, Metropolitan Museum of Art, American Museum of Natural History and many more. By the above description, you must be feeling that most of them are modern mega structures and the city is definitely missing some green destination. To add freshness and tranquillity to your vacation the majestic town boasts of one of the biggest and best park right in the heart of the city - the famous Central Park. This is a must-visit centre for every visitor across all ages. The sprawling park is spread in 843 acres, and the huge urban oasis is filled with uncountable trees and plants, colourful gardens, majestic meadows, and many beautiful and remarkable panoramas. The park is a blessing in itself as it presents a serene and calm atmosphere from the hustle and bustle of busy life for travellers as well as locals in all seasons. Every season brings a different colour and energy and visitors can enjoy a flowery spring, snowy winter, steamy summer or beautiful months of fall. A range of outdoor activities are the hallmark of the park and hiking, biking, ice-skating, ongoing live concerts or picnic with near and dear are popular choices to indulge in. So pack your bags and book cheap flights to New York for a fun-filled holiday. Central Park Attractions Central Park Zoo:- The zoo is filled with wildlife species from across the world and is a focal point for kids. Here you can find more than 130 species of animals kept according to their natural homes. The long list includes sea lions, polar bears, penguins, red panda, snow leopards and exotic birds. The Tisch Children's Zoo is a good place for young learners. Trump Rink and Victorian Gardens:- The famous recreational area serves a dual purpose, in summer it works as an amusement park and by winter, the destination becomes a hot favourite place for Ice-skating. The Mall:- The Mall area of the central park is filled with American elm trees which are an essential part of the town's environmental improvement and taking a stroll in the picturesque background is a heavenly feeling. Bethesda Fountain:- It is located in the heart of Central Park and is also known as the Angel of the Waters. The fountain is located at 72nd Street; people come here to enjoy the sun and to socialise. About the Author The enormous park is itself a full tourist destination. To explore this happening city book your tickets to New York as soon as you can. Flights to New York are conveniently available from most parts of the world.
